title: Bounds on the number of cells and the dimension of the Dressian
abstract:
The {\em Dressian} of a matroid $M$ is the set of all valuations of $M$. This
Dressian is the support of a polyhedral complex $\mathcal{Dr}(M)$ whose open
cells correspond 1-1 with matroid subdivisions of the matroid polytope of $M$.
We present upper bounds on the number of cells and the dimension of
$\mathcal{Dr}(M)$. For matroids $M$ of rank $r\geq 3$ on $n$ elements we show
that $$ \ln\#\mathcal{Dr}(M)\leq {\binom{n}{r}}
O\left(\frac{\ln(n)^2}{n}\right)\text{ as
}n\rightarrow\infty,\qquad\text{and}\qquad\dim \mathcal{Dr}(M)\leq
{\binom{n}{r}}\frac{3}{n-r+3},$$ as well as some more detailed bounds that
incorporate structural properties of such $M$. For uniform matroids $M=U(r,n)$,
these upper bounds are comparable to lower bounds derived from valuations that
are constructed from sparse paving matroids.
